caption: We opted for the sea plane ride out to the island. Right decision. Except I got put in the middle seat to preserve leg room? So I kind of had to lean over the shoulder of the stranger next to me to see anything. This picture is actually from our bonus day where we canoed around some of the bays on the island. The plane lined up way too perfectly.

Matt walking in the woods - classic. I think around here is where we got into some pretty dense foliage (that's ~90% of the island actually) and freaked out a moose. We were all a little tired and dazed and then about 5 feet off the trail a 2000 pound unit just rampaged away. Pretty cool. Probably should be a lil more observant.
This is the ferry! Docked in Rock Harbor, seen on our last day hiking. I really like the look of it, reminds me of like, The Perfect Storm. I've said it before, but I crave a large body of water.
On the way back from Scoville Point - golden hour. A little easier to navigate when the sun's out.

This is sunrise over at Scoville Point on the far east side of the island. I woke up early and ran out here after we camped in Rock Harbor. It was kind of sketchy, there were a few wood-plank paths that I couldn't see super well and almost slipped off a number of times. Then there's like, no trail at the end and you kind of just try to head eastward. Which is tough when there's no sun. Very very worth it though, I was the only one at the point for a while, was joined by 3 or 4 others right at sunrise.

You spend 3 days going through mostly dense, swampy forests, and then on the last day you get this trail that climbs around the rocky southern coast of the island. So neat. I want to go swim in that water.
